intro: Parabarium chunianum, commonly known as the Chinese parabarium, is a rare flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its square, hairy stems and opposite leaves with serrated edges. Its small, tubular flowers are typically purple or blue, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
